title: Notorious Evin Prison in Iran's capital in flames amid nationwide unrest
description: Iran's notorious Evin Prison went up in flames on Saturday. The regime has used the prison in Tehran to house political enemies and protesters following Mahsa Amini's death.

title: Turkish coal mine blast leaves 40 dead, many trapped: officials
description: Officials are working through the night to clear a coastal mine in Turkey following an explosion that left at least 40 people dead. Authorities attributed the cause to flammable gases.

title: Kentucky death toll from historic summer flooding rises to 43
description: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear announced that the death toll from the historic summer floods has risen to 43. The two latest deaths arose from health conditions related to the floods.

title: Pakistan bus fire kills 18 flood survivors
description: Pakistani flood survivors, including eight children and nine women, died in a bus fire while returning to their hometown, where flood waters supposedly receded.

title: Michigan man arrested after allegedly setting 25 fires on semitrailers in 8 states
description: A Michigan man was arrested for setting 25 fires on semitrailers over more than two years. The fires were set in eight states and all of the semitrailers belonged to the same company.

title: Greta Thunberg reverses course on nuclear power, argues Germany is making a mistake by taking plants offline
description: Germany's decision to lean into coal caught the attention of activist Greta Thunberg, who said the country would be making a mistake with nuclear plants still online.

title: Ukraine nuclear plant in Zaporizhzhia loses external power: 'Deeply worrying'
description: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant has lost external power. The head of the U.N.’s nuclear watchdog says safety mechanisms for the plant remain operational.

title: Reporter's Notebook: The missiles of October
description: Russia's nuclear capabilities and Russian president Vladimir Putin's overreach remain lingering threats as America nears its November midterm elections.

title: Tennessee firefighters find dead body in remains of Gatlinburg building that was destroyed in fire
description: Firefighters in Tennessee found a dead body in the remains of the fire that burned a building down in Gatlinburg. The fire damaged a block of businesses in the area.

title: MN ski lodge at Maplelag resort destroyed by fire
description: The main lodge at a popular ski resort was destroyed in a fire on Monday. The owner of the resort believes the fire started in the laundry room.

title: Train cables sabotaged and deliberately cut in Germany, forcing 3-hour halt
description: Train cables in Germany had been deliberately severed, forcing the transportation system to halt for nearly three hours. The sabotage is still under investigation.

title: Pompeo rips Biden's 'reckless' Armageddon remark: 'One of the greatest foreign policy failures'
description: Trump administration Secretary of State Mike Pompeo criticized President Biden's Armageddon comment as "reckless" and exhibiting a "failure to deter" Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Iconic Easter Island 'Moai' statues severely damaged in wildfire: 'It's irrecoverable'
description: Easter Island will open an investigation to determine the cause and full extent of the wildfire as well as the damage to the Moai statues to see what repairs can be done.

title: Ireland gas station explosion leaves at least 7 dead, more injured and missing: 'Very traumatic situation'
description: At least seven people were killed and eight others were injured in an explosion at a gas station in northwest Ireland, authorities said. Emergency crews said others remain missing.

title: Zelenskyy interview: Russia has begun to 'prepare their society' for possible use of nuclear weapons
description: Both Volodymyr Zelenskyy and White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre stressed that they've seen no signs Russia has imminent plans to use nuclear weapons.

title: String of 4 tremors detected 30 seconds apart in international waters near Denmark
description: Four small tremors have been detected 30 seconds apart in the Kattegat Sea near a Danish island. The small earthquakes were measured at less than 1 on the Richter scale.

title: Michigan firefighters battle paper mill fire in state's Upper Peninsula
description: Several fire crews battled a large fire at a paper mill in Michigan's Upper Peninsula. The fire began in a warehouse that contained pulp and waste paper.

title: After Indonesian soccer match left 131 dead, a look back on other major soccer crowd tragedies
description: A recent soccer match in Indonesia that turned into a deadly riot, killing at least 127 people, was not the first of its kind. Here's a list of other soccer games that ended in tragedy.

title: Kentucky woman's body found in creek, identified as missing flood victim
description: A Kentucky woman's body was found in a creek and has been identified as a victim of the historic July floods. The body was found Saturday near Troublesome Creek.

title: Florida completes repairs on Pine Island bridge in just 3 days
description: Florida emergency workers repaired the destroyed Pine Island Bridge in just three days this week. Pine Island residents had been stranded on the island by Hurricane Ian.

title: Putin orders Russian government to take over Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant following annexation
description: Europe's largest nuclear power plant faces renewed security threats as Russia says it will now 'supervise' the Zaporzhzhia power station following annexation.

title: Burning restrictions begin in Kentucky as wildfire hazard season approaches
description: With wildfire hazard season approaching in Kentucky, burning restrictions are going into place in the state. Restrictions will last through the end of Dec. 15.

title: Northern Kenya faces hunger crisis amid worst drought in 40 years
description: Residents in northern Kenya are suffering from a hunger crisis, as livestock and crops die from the country’s worst drought in decades.

title: Pakistan out of money for flood recovery, urges aid from UN
description: Pakistan has run out of money to spend on flood recovery. The monsoonal flooding has killed hundreds and displaced thousands of people.

title: 10 mountaineers dead after avalanche in northern India
description: An avalanche at India’s Garhwal Himalayas has killed 10 mountain climbers. Another 11 mountaineers went missing. However, rescuers have found eight survivors from the group.

title: California wells run dry as drought depletes groundwater
description: California is experiencing a major drought which is causing residents and even farmers to run out of water as their wells and underground aquifers dry out.

title: Hilaree Nelson, famed US extreme skier, gets traditional Nepalese funeral
description: Famed American extreme skier Hilaree Nelson will be given a traditional Nepalese funeral. Nelson died after falling from the world’s eighth-highest mountain in Nepal.

title: Nebraska Sandhills wildfire destroys campsite, forces officials to evacuate nearby village
description: The wildfire in Nebraska's Sandhills region has exploded in size to about 15,000 acres. A youth campsite was destroyed and officials evacuated a nearby village.

title: Poor Florida neighborhood battered by flood tries to recover
description: Gladiolus Food Pantry, a southwest Florida non-profit that supplies food for the community, has lost most of its donations due to flooding from Hurricane Ian.

title: Virginia to be hit with severe tidal flooding beginning Monday night
description: On Monday night, Virginia residents who live on the coast can expect severe tidal flooding. Remnants of Hurricane Ian have formed a nor’easter that is expected to cause the flooding.

title: Russia blindfolds, detains Ukraine nuclear plant chief
description: The Ukrainian state nuclear company Energoatom said Russian troops stopped Ihor Murashov’s car, blindfolded him and then took him to an undisclosed location.

title: NASCAR driver airlifted to hospital after trying to climb out of burning car
description: NASCAR driver Jordan Anderson was airlifted to a hospital near Talladega after suffering minor burns while escaping his vehicle, which was engulfed in flames.

title: Russia accused of kidnapping head of Ukraine nuclear plant
description: Russia has been accused of kidnapping the director general of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant just moments after Putin signed a decree claiming the region.

title: Fox News aerial video captures Fort Myers destruction: 'Thrown around like little toys'
description: Fox News rode along with the Lee County Sheriff's Office to capture the destruction left by Hurricane Ian.

title: Tiny kitten in Sarasota, Florida, is a Hurricane Ian survivor as shelter misses worst of storm
description: Animal shelters such as Cat Depot in Sarasota, Florida, were vulnerable during Hurricane Ian, given tough evacuation process — but some managed to escape the worst of the storm.

title: Virus kills 100K cows and buffaloes in India, livelihoods threatened
description: A viral outbreak in India has killed 100K cows and buffaloes and sickened another 2 million. The virus, known as lumpy skin disease, is spread through insects.

title: Massachusetts woman charged with arson, murder after allegedly starting apartment fire that killed 4
description: A Massachusetts woman is facing arson and murder charges after allegedly setting a fire in an apartment building. The fire killed four people.

title: South Carolina preps for Hurricane Ian with evacuations, sandbags, emergency shelters
description: South Carolina county governments are scrambling to prepare for the incoming Hurricane Ian after witnessing the storm's jaw-dropping destruction in Florida.

title: Joy Reid gloats over DeSantis’ asking for Biden’s hurricane help: He must ‘go hat in hand’ for aid
description: MSNBC host Joy Reid mocked Gov. Ron DeSantis, R-Fla., for having to go "hat in hand" seeking federal aid from President Biden for Hurricane Ian damage.

title: NBA announcer Mike Breen's home destroyed in fire
description: Longtime NBA announcer Mike Breen's home on Long Island, New York, was destroyed by fire early Sunday morning. Breen has called the NBA Finals since 2006.

title: Illinois woman dies 2 weeks after being seriously injured in house explosion
description: An Illinois woman died two weeks after she was injured in a house explosion. The woman died as a result of thermal injuries. The cause of the explosion remains under investigation.

title: More than 5,000 people affected by floods in Thailand
description: Flooding in Thailand from heavy tropical rainfall has displaced thousands of households and killed at least one person due to falling trees.

title: Tropical Storm Ian: Florida counties institute curfews, say violations could mean fines, jail time
description: Lee, Collier, Volusia and Flagler Counties in Florida instituted curfews in the wake of Tropical Storm Ian, which struck as a Category 4 hurricane Wednesday.

title: Bodies of 2 El Salvador children recovered after drowning in rain-swollen gully
description: Two El Salvador children died after they were swept away in a rain-swollen gully and drowned. Their bodies were later found by the residents of the area.

title: Mother, daughter rescued after car plunges into huge Guatemala sinkhole
description: A mother and her daughter have been rescued after their car plunged into a giant sinkhole in Villa Nueva, Guatemala. The search took three days.

title: Hurricane Ian is a storm we'll 'talk about for many years to come: National Weather Service director
description: National Weather Service Director Ken Graham spoke at a press conference Wednesday in which he warned Hurricane Ian would be remembered "for many years to come."

title: Hurricane flooding can be deadly to drivers. Here's what to do if you get caught
description: Residents in coastal areas are advised to evacuate long before a hurricane hits, but simple tips can help keep them safe if they get stuck in rising waters.

title: Arizona helicopter crew rescues family of 6 stranded on roof of vehicle during flood
description: Arizona rescuers performed a nighttime water rescue last week after a family of two adults and four children were trapped on top of their car when a wash flooded near Maricopa.

title: TUCKER CARLSON: What really happened to the Nord Stream pipeline?
description: Fox News host Tucker Carlson reacts to the gas leaks from the Nord Stream pipelines and analyzes what may have caused the incident on Tuesday's "Tucker Carlson Tonight."

title: Renowned US ski mountaineer missing after falling off world’s 8th highest mountain
description: Rescue teams are searching for a famed American ski mountaineer, Hilaree Nelson, who went missing near the peak of Mount Manaslu, the world’s eighth highest mountain.

title: Vietnam imposes curfew, evacuations ahead of Typhoon Noru
description: Vietnam enacted a curfew and evacuated more than 800,000 citizens after Typhoon Noru flooded several villages and left 8 dead in the Philippines on Tuesday.

title: North Korea, China resume cross-border train traffic for first time since pandemic
description: China and North Korea are resuming cross-border freight train operations. Traffic was previously suspended to limit the spread of COVID-19.

title: 95 people dead in ill-fated voyage on migrant boat from Lebanon
description: Over 100 people attempted to migrate to Europe in overcrowded boats to escape poverty in Lebanon. However, 95 people, including women and children, died in an accident.

title: WV woman who started fire that killed her parents sentenced to life, eligible for parole in 15 years
description: A woman from West Virginia who started a fire that killed her parents has been sentenced to life in prison. The woman will be eligible for parole in 15 years.

title: Chinese man missing for 17 days after earthquake in China found alive
description: A man in China survived 17 days in the mountains in China's southwest Sichuan province after a 6.8-magnitude earthquake rocked the country over two weeks ago.

title: 2 more whales die as death toll nears 200 in Australia mass stranding
description: Two more Tasmania whales have died after nearly 230 washed ashore in a mass stranding in Australia. Only 32 whales have been refloated as the death toll reaches 200.

title: 1 dead, over 20 missing after boat sinks near Cambodia
description: One person was found dead, over 20 people from China were missing after their small fishing boat sank in the Gulf of Thailand. However, 18 people were rescued on Thursday.

title: Lebanese migrant boat sinks in Syrian waters, death toll reaches 73
description: A migrant boat from Lebanon sank off the coast of Syria, killing at least 73 people. The Lebanese migrants were heading to Europe to escape a total economic collapse in Lebanon.

title: California man arrested after trying to light another man on fire
description: A California man was arrested after he poured a cup of gasoline on another man and tried to light him on fire. The victim was able to drive away before being ignited.

title: Earthquake in Mexico creates 'desert tsunami' 1,500 miles away in Death Valley National Park
description: Waves were triggered in the Devils Hole cave system at Death Valley National Park in Nevada by a 7.6 magnitude earthquake that struck western Mexico about 1,500 miles away.

title: El Salvador landslide kills at least 7 following 4 days of heavy rain
description: A landslide in El Salvador is confirmed to have killed at least seven people following four days of heavy rains. Authorities continue to search for more people trapped in the disaster.

title: Oil tanker catches fire off Gulf of Finland, crew extinguishes the flames
description: An 820-foot oil tanker burst into flames in the Gulf of Finland, but the crew was able to put out the blaze before anyone was injured. Estonian officials are investigating.

title: 6.8 magnitude earthquake strikes Mexico, killing at least 1
description: At least one person has been reported dead after a major magnitude 6.8 earthquake hit western Mexico on Thursday. A woman fell from her stairs and hit her head during the quake.

title: Chicago residents in shock after residential building explosion: 'All of a sudden I hear a boom'
description: Chicago residents living near a building that exploded remain in shock and disbelief Tuesday. One man says he would have been crushed by debris if he hadn't been running late.

title: Japanese man sets himself on fire to protest former PM Shinzo Abe’s funeral
description: A Japanese man deliberately doused himself in oil and set himself on fire to oppose the government’s decisions to hold a funeral for former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.

title: Pakistan is facing an outbreak of water-borne diseases
description: The risk of water-borne diseases like malaria and dengue fever is rising in Pakistan areas hit by major flooding. At least nine people have died during the monsoon season.

title: Mexicans feel anxiety after hit with third earthquake on a Sept. 19
description: Mexico experienced earthquakes on Sept. 19 in 1985, 2017, and 2022. The reoccurring disaster on this date is driving superstition among many in the country.

title: 4 dead after fiery crash involving car, tractor-trailer in Arizona
description: A tractor-trailer with broken brakes landed on a car and erupted in flames in Sedona, AZ. The truck driver escaped uninjured, but four car passengers died at the scene.

title: Damage assessments to begin in flooded remote Alaska villages
description: Officials will begin damage assessments of some of the most remote villages in the country. Communities in Alaska were flooded by a massive storm last weekend.

title: Hurricane Fiona upgraded to Category 3 as it heads for Turks and Caicos Islands
description: Hurricane Fiona began barreling toward for the Turks and Caicos Islands on Tuesday, after inflicting damage on the Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico. It is now a Category 3 storm.

title: PA farmhouse fire kills 4, 1 person still missing
description: A fire at a farmhouse in western Pennsylvania killed four people and required the help of about a dozen fire departments to put out the blaze. One person still remains missing.

title: Hurricane Fiona makes landfall in Dominican Republic after hitting Puerto Rico
description: Hurricane Fiona delivered "catastrophic" damage to Puerto Rico, and the storm made landfall in the Dominican Republic on Monday. No deaths have been reported in Puerto Rico.

title: 6.9 magnitude earthquake rocks Taiwan, triggers Tsunami alarm in Japan
description: A 6.9 magnitude earthquake struck the island of Taiwan on Sunday, reportedly killing one and injuring 79. First responders are on the scenes of collapsed buildings and bridges.

title: 42-floor Chinese skyscraper engulfed in flames
description: A China building was seen wreathed in flame on Friday. The cause of the fire at the China Telecom building was not immediately known. No casualties were reported.

title: Italy floods leave 10 dead
description: Flooding in central Italy left at least 10 dead and 4 missing. Firefighters said they rescued dozens of survivors from rooftops and trees.

title: North Cascades Highway shuts down due to mudslides, washout
description: North Cascades Highway, also known as State Route 20, was shut down due to massive mudslides. The route near Mazama, Washington, will be closed until further notice.

title: 'Chicago Fire' shooting was 'unbelievable,' funeral home director says real blaze nearby made scene 'chaotic'
description: "Chicago Fire" actors battled a fake fire when a real blaze broke out down the street, causing confusion among bystanders which was then followed by a shooting.

title: 'Chicago Fire' halts production after shooting near set in Oak Park, police confirm shooter 'fled scene'
description: "Chicago Fire" stopped production Wednesday after a gunman shot at a group of people standing nearby. The shooter remains at large after fleeing the scene.

title: Death toll from Kentucky flood reaches 40, latest victim died during cleanup effort
description: The death toll from the Kentucky floods that hit the state in July has risen to 40 after a person died during a cleanup effort in Pike County.

title: Maryland 11-year-old charged with arson in fire that destroyed dollar store
description: A Maryland boy has been charged with arson after he started a fire that destroyed a dollar store. The boy was charged with first-degree arson and released to his parent’s custody

title: Rental assistance available for 12 Kentucky counties affected by flooding
description: Kentucky counties of Breathitt, Clay, Floyd, Knott, Leslie, Letcher, Magoffin, Martin, Owsley, Perry, Pike, and Whitley are all eligible for continued rental assistance.

title: Alabama firefighters rescue dogs from roof of evacuated kennel
description: Alabama firefighters rescued dogs from the roof of a kennel on Monday after chemical fumes forced the workers to evacuate. The smaller dogs were taken out the front door to safety.

title: Retired Army command sergeant major saves 2 women from burning Alabama home
description: A retired Army command sergeant major saved two women who were trapped in a burning home in Alabama. The fire consumed the Enterprise home on Sept. 3.

title: FEMA will offer home improvement sessions for Kentucky flood victims
description: FEMA is offering home improvement sessions for Kentucky flood victims. The information from the sessions will be geared toward homeowners and general contractors.

title: Eight New Jersey firefighters injured after firetrucks responding to blaze collide
description: A crash between two firetrucks in Paterson, New Jersey as the vehicles were both responding to a fire has reportedly injured 8 firemen and sent several to the hospital.

title: College students born after 9/11 on what 21st anniversary of terrorist attacks means to them
description: College students across America share their thoughts on the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001 and share their hope of a unified nation ahead of the 21st anniversary.

title: North Korea threatens nuclear action if Kim Jong Un assassinated: report
description: North Korea will "automatically and immediately" use nuclear weapons if leader Kim Jong Un is assassinated, according to a new policy adopted Thursday.

title: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant faces 'precarious' threat as shelling cuts power, UN warns
description: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant faces a renewed threat as shelling cuts power to station and neighboring town

title: Mississippi's only burn center to close in October
description: The only burn center in Mississippi is closing on Oct. 14. The JMS Burn and Reconstruction Center has been helping burn victims for the last 14 years.

title: Michigan neighborhood in Kalamazoo evacuated after ruptured gas line caught fire
description: Michigan authorities evacuated homes in a neighborhood in Kalamazoo after a ruptured gas line caught fire. Some roads are expected to be closed through Thursday night.

title: US launches Minuteman III ICBM in show of nuclear readiness
description: U.S. launches Minuteman III intercontinental ballistic missile test from California in a show of nuclear readiness amid worsening relations with Russia.

title: North Dakota oil rig explosion injures 3, starts fire
description: An oil rig explosion in North Dakota injured three people and started a fire. Investigators are looking for the cause of the explosion. Crew members were taken to a burn center.

title: Montana triple-digit temperatures pose 'extremely critical' fire risk
description: Triple-digit temperatures in Northern Plains, MT, are expected to break records. The National Weather Service is warning residents of "extremely critical" fire conditions.

title: Water supply problems continue following Georgia flash floods
description: GA residents continue to deal with water supply problems in some areas following flash flooding. Chattooga officials announced water for 8,000 customers will be out of service.

title: Karaoke bar fire in Vietnam kills at least 12, injures dozens more
description: A karaoke bar fire in Binh Duong province of southern Vietnam killed at least 12 people and injured 40 others on Tuesday night, Vietnamese authorities say.

title: IAEA director warns of 'catastrophic' incident at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant: 'We are playing with fire'
description: The director of the United Nations nuclear watchdog warned on Tuesday that ongoing damage to the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine could be "catastrophic."

title: More task forces arrive to fight Oregon wildfire
description: Two additional task forces arrived to tackle the Double Creek fire in northeastern Oregon, bringing the total number of firefighters to 401.

title: 6.8-magnitude China earthquake death toll rises to 66
description: A massive 6.8 magnitude earthquake near the Tibetan Plateau in Sichuan, China has claimed the lives of at least 66 people and leveled residences.

title: UN inspectors find damage to Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia buildings housing 'fresh' nuclear fuel, radioactive waste
description: The UN's International Atomic Energy Agency documented damage to Zaphorizhzhia nuclear power plant buildings that house "fresh" nuclear fuel and solid radioactive waste.

title: Indiana woman killed in flash flood, multiple homes destroyed
description: An Indiana woman was found dead following flash flooding in parts of Jefferson and Switzerland counties. Two homes were destroyed and 40 buildings were damaged in the floods.

title: 2 die in Illinois house explosion
description: Two Illinois residents have died in a house explosion outside LaSalle according to the sheriff's office. The identities of the two people have not been released.

title: Taiwan offers to send emergency responders to China after devastating 6.8 magnitude earthquake
description: Taiwan offered to emergency responders to aid China's rescue efforts after an earthquake Tuesday, the first olive branch amid weeks of heightened military tensions.

title: California wildfire leaves 2 dead, explodes to 700 acres as evacuations are ordered
description: At least two people were killed and another person injured in the Fairview fire that is burning in East Hemet, California, according to Cal Fire. The wildfire has spread to 700 acres.

title: India carnival ride plummets 50 feet, injuring multiple people – including children – in horrifying video
description: A high-rise carousel malfunctioned at a fair in India, plummeting 50 feet to the ground and injuring multiple people, including children.

title: 'Heroic' next-door neighbor saves mother, 2 children in Boston house fire
description: A Boston, Massachusetts, resident is being praised by the city’s fire department for a “heroic job” helping a mother and two children escape from a blaze.

title: Deadly 6.8 magnitude earthquake shakes southwest China
description: A strong earthquake killed multiple people, triggered landslides and shook residents in a major city under COVID-19 lockdown in southwestern China on Monday, state media reported.

title: California state AG refuses to crack down on illegal fireworks causing wildfires, damage
description: California Attorney General Rob Bonta has opted against taking action in response to requests from state municipalities urging him to prosecute the illegal fireworks trade.

title: Wildfires destroy 10,000 acres in Southern California amidst record-breaking heat wave
description: Wildfires in Southern California have burned nearly 10,000 acres of land as the Golden States faces one of the hottest heat waves on record.

title: West Virginia crew returns after containing fires in California
description: A West Virginia Division of Forestry crew returned from California after three weeks of helping contain wildfires. The crew helped around Willows, CA, and other areas across the state.

title: Russia accuses Ukraine of installing spies at Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant amid IAEA inspection
description: Russia has accused Ukraine of attempting to install spies at that Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant as the United Nations nuclear watchdog inspects the site.

title: State Department calls Iran’s response to US final draft proposal to revive nuclear deal ‘not constructive’
description: Iran called its response to a U.S. proposal to revive the Iran Nuclear Deal a "constructive approach," but the U.S. says it strongly disagrees, as negotiations on the shattered agreement continue.

title: Dead fish are piling up on the shores of San Francisco Bay Area
description: Dead fish are washing ashore in the San Francisco Bay Area due to a toxic algae bloom known as red tide. The red tide and carcasses are creating an odor that may worsen due to heat.

title: UN nuclear team arrives at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia plant after shelling delayed travel
description: The UN team from the International Atomic Energy Agency arrived at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant after shelling nearby delayed their arrival.

title: Atlanta skyscraper fire sends a dark column of smoke into the sky
description: A fire broke out on the rooftop of a skyscraper that was under construction in Atlanta. Construction workers spilled out of the building before firefighters extinguished the blaze.

title: Ukraine nuclear plant worker says Russia evacuated its personnel ahead of attacks on Zaporizhzhia
description: A former worker at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant said Ukrainian personnel knew Russia was behind the attacks after it evacuated its nuclear experts.

title: Hundreds gather for New Orleans second line parade to mark 17 years since Hurricane Katrina
description: Hundreds of people gathered to share their stories of surviving Hurricane Katrina on Monday, 17 years after the storm struck, killing more than 1,800 people.

title: What are the best spots to visit in Yellowstone? Here's how much it costs to enter the oldest national park
description: Yellowstone National Park is one of the most visited attractions in the United States and is home to a diverse landscape and wildlife.

title: Historic European drought reveals previously submerged ancient Roman ruins
description: A severe drought and record low water levels along the Lima River in Northwest Spain have caused a previously submerged ancient Roman settlement to reappear.

title: Virginia house fire kills 2 people
description: A fire that erupted at a home in Virginia killed two people on Friday. Officials say the fire doesn’t appear to be suspicious, but the investigation into the cause is ongoing.

title: Italian girl, 7, crushed by marble statue while playing in Munich hotel courtyard
description: A 7-year-old Italian girl was tragically crushed to death by a statue at a hotel last week while vacationing with her family in Munich, Germany.

title: Alabama fatal fire allegedly was started by a child playing with a lighter
description: Authorities believe an Alabama child was playing with a lighter when he started a mobile home fire. Two out of the three children in the mobile home died from smoke inhalation.

title: California facing recording-breaking heat wave this week
description: The Golden States will experience triple-digit temperature conditions as the National Weather Service predicts a record-breaking heat wave.

title: Pakistan flooding deaths pass 1,000 in ‘climate catastrophe’
description: Pakistan has seen over 1,000 deaths since mid-June as a result of widespread flash flooding from heavy rains during monsoon season.

title: Mississippi flooding: Governor declares state of emergency with river expected to crest at 36 feet Monday
description: Mississippi Gov. Tate Reeves, a Republican, declared a state of emergency due to new projections that now estimate the Pearl River could peak at 36 feet waters.

title: Colorado drunk driving suspect crashes into DMV while street racing, police say
description: The Colorado DMV released surveillance video of a 20-year-old man crashing into a Pueblo office while allegedly under the influence and street racing.

title: Ukraine nuclear plant occupied by Russian forces temporarily cut off from power grid
description: Europe's largest nuclear power plant located in southern Ukraine was temporarily cut off from the power grid on Thursday due to fire damage, Energoatom said.

title: Kentucky lawmakers call special session to discuss assisting flood-damaged eastern Kentucky
description: Kentucky lawmakers discussed direct aid into parts of eastern Kentucky that were devastated by historic floods. The disaster has caused at least 39 deaths.

title: Japan's PM suggests country build new nuclear power plants
description: Prime Minister of Japan Fumio Kishida said Wednesday that he is interested in looking into new types of nuclear reactors for his country to develop amid rising energy costs.

title: Rhode Island officials declare drought disaster, restrict water usage
description: Rhode Island is currently in the midst of a drought. Federal officials declared a disaster in the state as the drought continues to worsen.

title: Eastern Kentucky residents can receive disaster food benefits
description: People in eastern Kentucky who live in areas damaged by last month's flooding can apply for disaster food benefits. The Department of Agriculture will issue the benefits.

title: Superyacht sinking off Italian coast caught on video
description: The Italian Coast Guard captured the moment a 130-foot superyacht sank into the Mediterranean Sea stern-first, after My Saga's captain issued a distress call.

title: Section of Beirut grain silos damaged in 2020 Lebanon explosion collapses
description: The northern section of a group of previously damaged silos collapsed after a fire slowly burned in the block for weeks after grain trapped inside ignited.

title: Fire that destroyed Massachusetts marina was caused by gasoline vapors, investigators say
description: A marina fire in Massachusetts that destroyed buildings, vehicles, and boats was started by gasoline vapors that ignited when a gas tank was being replaced.

title: Russian officials agree to open Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant to UN inspectors: report
description: Russia will allow United Nations inspectors access to the Zaporizhzhia power plant, which it has controlled since early March and which it has refused to demilitarize despite concerns.

title: Kim Jong Un's sister tells South Korean president to 'shut his mouth' about nuclear disarmament deal
description: The sister of North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un, Kim Yo Jong, told the President of South Korea to "shut his mouth" after offering to aid the north in exchange for nuclear disarmament.

title: Indiana widow facing murder charges in firefighter husband's execution death; another man also charged
description: An Indiana woman whose husband was shot to death in their driveway more than three years ago was charged with murder in his death on Thursday, police announced.

title: Famed Catskills resort hotel Grossinger's burns down
description: Part of the abandoned Grossinger's Catskill Resort Hotel burned down Tuesday. The local fire department reported the cause of the fire was under investigation.

title: Iran officials to demand penalty payment should US pull out of Nuclear Deal again: report
description: The U.S. and Iran have used the approaching deadline for the agreement of the nuclear deal to push for additional demands, including an end to Iranian assassination efforts.

title: Virginia volunteer firefighter charged with setting fire to abandoned building
description: A volunteer firefighter in Virginia is being charged with setting fire to an abandoned building. His crew was the first to arrive at the scene of the fire, according to investigators.

title: WV National Weather Services forecast thunderstorms in flooded areas of state
description: WV National Weather Services have forecasted more thunderstorms this week across the state. On Monday, 5 inches of rain fell in some areas of West Virginia.

title: Titanic's Billy Zane takes viewers into the tragic story behind the ill-fated 'ship of dreams' on Fox Nation
description: Actor and 'Titanic star' Billy Zane narrates Fox Nation's 'Titanic Secrets,' a series dedicated to exploring and uncovering key secrets of the infamous disaster at sea.

title: Kentucky flood survivors receive much needed assistance with new FEMA recovery centers
description: Kentucky opened new FEMA mobile disaster recovery centers on Sunday to help flood survivors. The new centers are in Magoffin and Booneville.

title: Marine Corps investigation finds pilot error killed four Marines in Norway
description: An investigation into a fatal Marines Osprey crash that left four dead in Bodo, Norway in March has determined that pilot error was the reason for the disaster.

title: Investigation links New Mexico fire to power lines downed by tree
description: A falling tree started a fire in New Mexico, which destroyed 200 homes and killed an elderly couple. Wind gusts over 80 miles per hour blew the tree into an electric line.

title: Pennsylvania man accused of plowing into crowd, murdering mother said he was tired of arguing with her: report
description: The suspect accused of plowing through a crowd then murdering his mother in Pennsylvania reportedly told police that he was tired of arguing with her.

title: Fire at Coptic Church in Egypt kills dozens, mostly children: report

description: It's not just earthquakes that can trigger tsunamis.

title: Japan flooding death toll nears 60 as 'unprecedented' rain batters main island
description: Torrential rains that triggered deadly flooding across southern Japan moved northward on Wednesday, triggering mudslides and more evacuations across the country's main island.

title: June 2020 was 'tornado drought,' fewest number of US twisters in nearly 70 years, forecasters say
description: After a destructive Spring that made 2020 the deadliest year for tornadoes in nine years, an unusually quiet May continued into June, with some record low activity recorded.

title: Japan flooding death toll rises to 53, a dozen missing as torrential rains spread through region
description: Search and rescue crews in Japan fanned out across towns in the country's southern region on Tuesday as the death toll from devastating flooding ticked upwards as more heavy rain is expected.

title: Lightning strikes in India kill 147 over 10 days, hundreds have died since May
description: Nearly four dozen people were fatally struck by lightning on Saturday in northern India, joining the hundreds who have died from strikes in the past two months.

title: Japan flooding death toll rises to 49 as more heavy rain hits region
description: Torrential rain brought another deluge to southern Japan on Monday as the death toll from days of flooding and mudslides climbed to at least 49 people as rescuers searched for missing people.

title: Suspected South American drug plane bursts into flames after illegal highway landing in Mexico
description: A small plane suspected of carrying hundreds of pounds of illegal drugs from South America landed on a highway in southern Mexico and burst into flames, Mexican military officials said Sunday.

title: Tropical Storm Edouard forms in far North Atlantic, enters the record books
description: An area of disturbed weather over the North Atlantic Ocean became the latest tropical storm on Sunday night and made its way into the record books.

title: China braces for more storms after floods leave 121 dead or missing this year
description: A wide swath of southern China braced Sunday for more seasonal rains and flooding that state media said has already left more than 120 people dead or missing this year

title: Japan floods leave up to 34 dead, many at nursing homes
description: Deep floodwaters and the risk of more mudslides that left at least 34 people confirmed or presumed dead hampered search and rescue operations Sunday in southern Japan.

title: Shark attack in Australia kills man spearfishing, fourth deadly attack this year
description: A 36-year-old man who was spearfishing off the east coast of Australia died Saturday after being attacked by a shark, according to officials.

title: At least two dead, dozens injured as explosion rocks Turkish fireworks factory
description: At least two people have died and 74 have been wounded as a Turkish fireworks factory was rocked by a series of explosions on Friday.

title: Landslide at Myanmar jade mine triggers 'muddy wave,' killing over 160, shocking video shows
description: A hillside of rock and debris slides down a hill into a crater, triggering a massive wave on a lake in shocking footage that shows the deadly landslide in Myanmar that struck a jade mine.

title: Horse rescued by lifeboat crew in Ireland after bolting out a mile into sea
description: A runaway horse in Ireland was rescued earlier this week after bolting over a mile into the Atlantic Ocean, according to officials.
